74933CF8813848AFA1E9EB2D5C363D8F.description: Use grade appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases accurately within informational writing.

82254494B3EA497AA4966457EE1EC070.description: Use general academic and domain specific words and phrases accurately.

3AC342B21B0C4FED9A3CDD5C020421E4.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal contrast,
addition, and other logical relationships (e.g., however, although, nevertheless, similarly, moreover, in addition).

06CD168A157A4E71B259FDF95E77ACB6.description:
Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) in writing to promote understanding
of each of the words.

52CE812252DB49C6A2E4705FC9F1959E.description: Identify the meaning of common idioms or proverbs.

50114B37EE7040A0BE0954EF4F5553B9.description: Use figurative language in context, including similes and metaphors.

4BE69C8F8E4E4F6CB46109F6FB8734EF.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text including figurative language such as metaphors
and similes.

A0210E59685942E7B74F29B154B39032.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
a. Interpret figurative language, including similes and metaphors, in context.
b. Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.
c. Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to better understand each of the words.

BA9CC991468A496C9C3829D23496434A.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the meaning of a word.

00AD1C9EF83A401EA93B096088DDE0CB.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the pronunciation of a word.

F271FC2B086E4ED6B5AA68B84396CBC7.description: Use common grade-appropriate roots and affixes as clues to the meaning of a word.

79B92095DE974F2F9D27CCC68BEAB142.description: Use context to determine the meaning of unknown or multiple meaning words.

ADCCDE5B6C0E4DBA8365CAA254C3B8B8.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing
flexibly from a range of strategies.
a. Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).
b. Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.
c. Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or
clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

97A93970D29D43249802885E488E0208.description: Expand, combine, and reduce sentences for meaning, reader interest, and style within writing.

48ED045859244E91BA823A7615427FE2.description:
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.
a. Expand, combine, and reduce sentences for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.
b. Compare and contrast the varieties of English (e.g., dialects, registers) used in stories, dramas, or poems.

F8B7E9D521644AB69586523F34069FF4.description: Spell words correctly in writing, consulting references as needed.

C0E63BA416154723AE096EF1D8BDE727.description: Use punctuation to separate items in a series.

726D9DAFFC8B4DC7B1DAD9963F6A512B.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
a. Use punctuation to separate items in a series.
b. Use a comma to separate an introductory element from the rest of the sentence.
c. Use a comma to set off the words yes and no (e.g., Yes, thank you), to set off a tag question from the rest of the sentence (e.g., It’s true, isn’t
it?), and to indicate direct address (e.g., Is that you, Steve?).
d. Use underlining, quotation marks, or italics to indicate titles of works.
e. Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

9F78F81E58C44A3FBA40E7C8F07EFC61.description: Identify and use conjunctions, prepositions, and interjections in writing.

32C0A7FCCB6E467C92D5A96297E5D574.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense.

7C3D2D3621D74EA89314A53F003FA2A7.description: Use appropriate verb tense to convey times, sequence, state, and condition.

5A5B6A86E3E64E3B8B874CF3BFA5EDD7.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
a. Explain the function of conjunctions, prepositions, and interjections in general and their function in particular sentences.
b. Form and use the perfect (e.g., I had walked; I have walked; I will have walked) verb tenses.
c. Use verb tense to convey various times, sequences, states, and conditions.
d. Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense.
e. Use correlative conjunctions (e.g., either/or, neither/nor).
f. Write and organize one or more paragraphs that contain: a topic sentence, supporting details, and a conclusion that is appropriate to the
writing task (Reference Writing standards 1-3).

6E96E365C20248D2BF370BBD2324B440.description: No CCCs written for this standard.

A12D47BF4DE44E5DAA0E4698DB53C721.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using formal English when appropriate to task and situation. (See grade 5 Language standards
1 and 3 for specific expectations.)

45511124DB5546269011B3FAA284CEDD.description:
Use captioned pictures, labeled diagrams, tables, or other visual displays in presentations when appropriate to support the
topic or theme.

10B79EBA0D234F9FAC8CA49C358C0B34.description:
Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, sound) and visual displays in presentation when appropriate to enhance the
development of topic.

BEDD5BE17181431B85CA012DB2C5AD0F.description:
Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, sound) and visual displays in presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of
main ideas or themes.

D4A68A7E8E2E4136A150686230920CC3.description: Elaborate on each fact or opinion given in support of a claim with relevant details.

4474D9573F9B4C82BE8E4CE186AB76D1.description: Report on a topic, story or claim using a logical sequence of ideas, appropriate facts, and relevant and descriptive details.

A7F54126FF814F478172B3EF9D3A28F8.description:
Report on a topic or text or present an opinion, sequencing ideas logically and using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to
support main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.

E8C22A9269BB4C009A422015BD29D8AF.description: Explain how at least one claim in a discussion is supported by reasons and evidence.

E0F6821115584F2CAD640293814E5E36.description: Identify reasons and evidence that a speaker provides to support points or claims.

C6D2CC0C7649433E8A3749865C1E709D.description: Summarize the points a speaker makes.

88754BB29FA8451488E25C9B8EF44860.description: Identify a speaker's points or claims.

9FC9CFC3696246568036C70E9BE446BB.description: Summarize the points a speaker makes and explain how each claim is supported by reasons and evidence.

C9E4CF7CDDA448FD85DFE81249DCA42F.description: Summarize the text or a portion of the text read, read aloud, or presented in diverse media.

9E72510D9A17424E9768B963F408B8A5.description: Determine the narrative point of view of a text read, read aloud or viewed.

682203C7C8D1484F94C6B971A25993F8.description: Summarize a written text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

1699B9010E40404B88FD5E79CF236D16.description: Review the key ideas expressed within a collaborative discussion.

97C04E89F25F43839F342267752F1EC8.description: Make appropriate comments that contribute to a collaborative discussion.

FFE2161D798240EBAB58C4502BF0E38C.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 5 topics and
texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.
a. Come to discussions prepared having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known
about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.
b. Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.
c. Pose and respond to specific questions by making comments that contribute to the discussion and elaborate on the remarks of others.
d. Review the key ideas expressed and draw conclusions based on information and knowledge gained from the discussions.

B0B0093A8B6C447D96256E5856AEA59F.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

326998DA93B54671B3463057064FD704.description:
Demonstrate and apply handwriting skills.
a. Read and write cursive letters, upper and lower case.
b. Transcribe ideas legibly and fluently with appropriate spacing and indentation.

F1950F29F87243008B5891283D154C1D.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

1A476BF7191E432AA21766213FCE0FE2.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two)
for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

FF002E6020814372A8AEEE957E648565.description:
Analyze mentor texts to support knowledge of persuasive writing (e.g., analyze newspaper editorials to explore the way the
author developed the argument).

D27242CC21BB4B5C8CA20DF9DC4229B5.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
a. Apply grade 5 Reading standards to literature.
b. Apply grade 5 Reading standards to informational texts

07EAE9EA014543D4921630A0454EC21A.description: Sort evidence collected from print and/or digital sources into provided categories.

1AD64AB167724973B7BA68FD869A1676.description: Provide a list of sources that contributed to the content within a writing piece.

2B2E6046409A4A0EA6765A7E9E1BE18C.description: Provide a list of sources that contributed to the content within a writing piece.

67DF66FA264D47DBAE8FDDA376CA17CD.description: Gather information (e.g., highlight, quote, or paraphrase from source) relevant to the topic from print and/or digital sources.

468572BCEC97401092D7042EB7B3555F.description:
Gather relevant information (e.g., highlight in text, quote or paraphrase from text) to the topic or text from print and/or digital
sources.

2E80A699D4C14F718070C60CDF0CF733.description:
Gather relevant information (e.g., highlight in text, quote, or paraphrase from text or discussion) from print and/or digital
sources.

AC691C7B7FC84C29A06A3FCD99DF7604.description:
Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; summarize or paraphrase
information in notes and finished work, and provide a list of sources.

6C7B4AFCF6164037B910078D2546537D.description:
Follow steps to complete a short research project (e.g., determine topic, locating information on a topic, organizing
information related to the topic, drafting a permanent product).

54495896CDE242B7BA29C6C16099EE15.description:
Conduct short research projects that use several sources to build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic and to answer
a specific question.

8B8285CC509245CA82DBA58F2BE6C653.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

363FDDF5AC584F7A96CBFEFE01CE4291.description: Use search tools or text features as a means of locating relevant information.

4CE6E569B6F64C33BDD5D27FD23BFF11.description:
Use technology to produce and publish writing. (e.g., use internet to gather information; use word processing to generate and
collaborate on writing).

E7048A8D4C954FB78E0BDD6D21F34AC4.description:
With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and
collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills in order to complete a writing task.

FEBF46B8415D4930A93F5053BEE738DE.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising and editing.

32E13C99FC264A6EB2974FB6248543BD.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising and editing.

37916F7820254C60AE89EAF9C17B4CBA.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising and editing (e.g., review product,
strengthening story).

520E313431804F9D8E6407278A394924.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing. (e.g., determine the topic, gather information,
develop the topic, provide a meaningful conclusion).

07449BC4531D44F3991758584474C423.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., choose a topic, introduce story elements,
develop storyline, conclude story).

45B12023749E4C479893520343D5BD58.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., define purpose, which is to persuade, state
your claim, gather evidence, create your argument, provide a meaningful conclusion).

12B1977B7DC046D89FC324C5BA39C93D.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying
a new approach. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including grade 5.)

B2776EFE77DD4FE6AC4F40F4F4D9695A.description: Produce a clear coherent permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose, and audience.

316DC92B8FA64734A033BD06F7EFD0AD.description:
Produce a clear coherent permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose (e.g., to entertain), and
audience.

D928A16BC2EC433D9446509D701014F3.description:
Produce a clear coherent permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task (e.g., topic), purpose (e.g., to inform), and
audience (e.g., reader).

6D721AA619274A758C7AD58B449081F3.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific
expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

DC1A9CA46B554011BD0D9581232F09F7.description: Provide a conclusion (concluding sentence, paragraph, or extended ending) that follows from the narrated events.

C8CB34F88FB644E6A2D65611CC666240.description: Write a narrative that includes smaller segments of conflict and resolution in the text that contribute to the plot.

E2A4CEBC16C64D7D80DF5D252F9B8916.description: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

A1D4EFCDC05C4117A66468A8BC0ECFC5.description: Use transitional words, phrases, and clauses to manage the sequence of events.

6444D1CC96EE4A35B464E8ECBBC80D49.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, description, and pacing, to develop experiences and events or show the
responses of characters to situations.

7AA5B9E1571044E0879157C8BFC687CD.description: Organize ideas and event so that they unfold naturally.

1797F18A3E2A46B0BEA982DB4E727A49.description: Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters.

ADA4064240D04C4FA127207FE1924A7F.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.
a. Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds
naturally.
b. Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue and description, to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to
situations.
c. Use a variety of transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of events.
d. Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.
e. Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

2E7373B13D0D4C26BD3F5C5A0DE7F8D8.description: Provide a concluding statement or section to summarize the information presented.

BF55AD4ED62542ECB464E504B7620589.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

11041E9ED9C0467386B5318E1AC56144.description: Use transitional words, phrases, and clauses that connect ideas and create cohesion within writing.

FD08B43D38B441A79A52277DD4C41325.description:
Include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia appropriate to convey information about the
topic.

9DB6BC6631534286A2D69D8A1F2E79B2.description: Support the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

0773A3B6260C403CB1CAC405CD6C2363.description:
Organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and
cause/effect.

CC3706DB58C14787993AF3EBD3A1F69E.description: Write an introduction that includes context/background information, establishes a central idea or focus about a topic.

02F37B08826043668673B9025E45D32E.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.
a. Introduce a topic clearly, provide a general observation and focus, and group related information logically; include formatting (e.g.,
headings), illustrations, and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.
b. Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.
c. Link ideas within and across categories of information using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., in contrast, especially).
d. Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.
e. Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or explanation presented.

E84B832938CB429A970BB3143FCACA27.description: Provide a clear concluding statement or section related to the opinion stated.

0FBE735F6364433CB49822B4D423947E.description: Link opinions and reasons using words, phrases, and clauses.

152B981C18024A60A1A954735033B3CB.description: Provide relevant facts to support stated opinion or reasons within persuasive writing.

4D9440B1EAB342ED8E405DD9FF4510CF.description: Create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the writer's opinion.

8735FAA90AB64466A7772C35580A7698.description: Write an introduction that states own opinion within persuasive text.

8C32E661AB5B46AFA453C60496804C64.description:
Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information.
a. Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the
writer’s purpose.
b. Provide logically ordered reasons that are supported by facts and details.
c. Link opinion and reasons using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., consequently, specifically).
d. Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.

6C79F6E2181B4E26985C39832807156A.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition.

16643DA0951C49F1B90ADEDCE6D3C061.description:
Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.
a. Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.
b. Read grade-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.
c. Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

816A9BF1041F4DA78997BB45ADC5E078.description: Use morphemes (e.g., roots and affixes) to decode unfamiliar multisyllabic words in and out of context.

251A05C971CD4075B7576303E65E85AE.description:
Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills in decoding multisyllabic words in context and out of context.
a. Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences to accurately read unfamiliar multisyllabic words.
b. Apply knowledge of the six syllable patterns to read grade level words accurately.
c. Use combined knowledge of morphology to read grade level words accurately.
d. Know and apply common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots to accurately read unfamiliar words.

3665457D5C8E4D68938048E1373361D1.description: Use a variety of strategies (e.g., use context, affixes and roots) to derive meaning from a variety of print/non-print texts.

4AC8DC66551F47178DFFE136968EE5BF.description: Read or be read to a variety of texts including graphic novels, poetry, fiction, and nonfiction novels.

4DF66ECA636A4F84A43C71DD38F7C3A8.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend informational text, including history/social studies, science and
technological texts, in a text complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 5.

04099F0E7D5F4DC5B7ABACA8C2331C04.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

99CBEE6CB50A49978D614D45218CE533.description: Integrate information on a topic from multiple sources to answer a question or support a focus or opinion.

6CC95B695CFF4A15B4E2688ABC3A2C64.description: Identify key details from multiple sources on the same topic (e.g., what are the important things that you learned?).

8453619EFE7F45248AF1F91E6EB3266D.description: Integrate information from several texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

74CA3EC4A98A44D9A504098CF190AA2D.description: Identify evidence the author uses to support stated thesis/claim/opinion.

1E5185BDC3DD4D1E94DEA35A55495504.description: Identify reasons and evidence that support an author's point(s) in a text.

C29F9A73C3924E8D85A37F6FCF367F02.description: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text.

75D7F94C79F54453BEFAB7F4BFDFAC92.description:
Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which
point(s).

2F0590799198490380E302E0C5485B1F.description: Refer to multiple print or digital sources as support for inferences (e.g., how did you know?).

98A59B0DB5CE4E61BF1A6301E6ECD3D6.description:
Draw on information from multiple print or digital sources, demonstrating the ability to locate an answer to a question or to
solve a problem.

C276E869C9614639B973F20B9415B43D.description:
Draw on information from multiple print or digital sources, demonstrating the ability to locate an answer to a question quickly or to solve a
problem efficiently.

592DE41776D14EBD92C7C5B8D2194941.description: Note important similarities and differences in the point of view of multiple accounts of the same event or topic.

DEFC807816444DA7883E3CACBF0A3635.description: Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting important similarities and differences in the point of view they represent.

9670A0E9B70F4B869FA61903C0E953A3.description:
Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas,
concepts, or information in two or more texts.

C5829EFA64794B96BBC8094C67FDBF56.description: Use signal word to identify common types of text structure.

222138A051A344E1B218FB8F6AE95FD8.description:
Use signal words as a means of locating information (e.g., knowing that "because" or "as a result of" may help link a cause to
a result).

CFE86186C2404A0EB7E3389CBB5C6676.description:
Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, and problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or
information in two or more texts.

5E76F76AA3DA498199718297A75F0AB7.description:
Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic or
subject area.

3914A3B698854977A1A2AD7435DC10AB.description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic or subject area.

64465C143E3745948A99A73CBEE34059.description:
Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific,
or technical text based on specific information across texts.

97ED643DA2CF4C63934C470E703AB571.description:
Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific,
or technical text based on specific information in the text.

E74242D2450B437AA1B6ED74C490FE21.description:
Explain/identify the relationship between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or
technical text.

05B17607A5B145A8A004E1F083BE55C8.description:
Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text,
based on specific information in the text.

81E36101CAC54349BED9C2569770CE35.description: Summarize the text or a portion of the text read, read aloud, or presented in diverse media.

BE738523363E45B5B1268E363E781E3C.description: Determine the main idea, and identify key details to support the main idea.

76F640732BE7468FB3C598CC4DB377FE.description: Determine two or more main ideas of a text and explain how they are supported by key details; summarize the text.

23EFA6E3D5D64DC08001D5DA546ADA8F.description: Quote accurately from a text to support inferences.

DFD50822F46246E29AFA0252E005C643.description: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly.

209D683941294F9FBA338F57DDEE02FC.description: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

69BB61C95AAA40A0B99EB7F613F23E26.description: Use a variety of strategies to derive meaning from a variety of texts.

7B215C91841D4BF2AC493FA19179F0CA.description: Read or be read to a variety of texts or adapted texts including graphic novels, poetry, fiction and nonfiction novels.

7E3A8638178B45AB94E062DB5A544A63.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, in a text
complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 5.

520D341916AA4AD78A68C1E52271E454.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

F8DA12C21423492C8903D6CB9BA24AE4.description:
Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure stories) on their approaches to similar themes
and topics.

94AD29A189BC4892A32C6B9AFED9BF93.description: Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure stories) on their approaches to similar themes and topics.

5D67EF0D30534BF1BE61901C56B5BCB6.description:
Describe how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the meaning or tone of a text (e.g., graphic novel, multimedia
presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).

3687B298C2BA49ED9CBFAC8DE74BEEBC.description:
Analyze how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the purpose, meaning, or tone of the text (e.g., graphic novel, multimedia
presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, and poem).

48A95D65A5534125BD92E38788A94C4B.description: Interpret the meaning of metaphors and similes to help determine the mood within a text.

925D30F93E974B98B324B1132BE2E31F.description: Interpret the meaning of metaphors and similes to help explain the setting within a text.

86EA0F948F814DED9001E7E1291C94FD.description: Explain how the description of characters, setting, or events might change if the person telling the story changed.

24397CB13AB54D7287FCEEDDF4B0DA02.description: Describe how a narrator's or speaker's point of view influences how events are described.

18DF3F1A9FF6477DBD7E3488D20FF630.description: Describe how a narrator’s or speaker’s point of view influences how events are described.

82C99A30D04C431ABD4B4EEEE19F0A00.description: Explain how a series of chapters fits together to provide the overall structure of a particular text.

785CBC843AF54DB7AD102E19CBB9062E.description:
Use signal words (e.g., meanwhile, unlike, next) to identify common types of text structure (e.g., sequence, compare/contrast,
cause/effect, description) within a text.

C916BE9E62F44F9A88B49FDAE6F6C2D8.description: Explain how a series of chapters, scenes, or stanzas fits together to provide the overall structure of a particular story, drama, or poem.

EEAD9EB4489B48A095C4B6E367F9946C.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text including figurative language such as metaphors
and similes.

7C4B282CC55E4DBF8CCF0C57CF1654D8.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language such as metaphors and similes.

6CC62D50997743609A12BCC6F918E87A.description:
Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text
(e.g., how characters interact).

C27FE21A0E8B405A94239F817D6D4EB7.description: Compare characters, settings, events within a story; provide or identify specific details in the text to support the comparison.

13EFF151235A47109B760DEF7227AB25.description:
Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., how
characters interact).

B83D494881374F128C72D16EAF5D67D6.description:
Determine the theme of a story, drama, or poem including how characters in a story or drama respond to challenges or how
the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic.

C2F7FBF7321B4857AB9222470024EC40.description: Summarize a text from beginning to end in a few sentences.

E1999A79F13C4A789EFCFE82F2B85BCD.description: Summarize a portion of text such as a paragraph or a chapter.

6E8FECC0CA154BFE80D720AA65C90996.description:
Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details of the text; include how characters in story or drama respond to challenges, how
the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic, and a summary of the text.

3E57A2C8791944B89EBE0B0E919C7FE5.description: Refer to specific text evidence to support inferences, interpretations, or conclusions.

42B3E6C0B6134A0A984416BDF11C4F18.description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly.

2ED19392A2B04E73AB5EB800217F3C02.description: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.
